abstract: During the visit of the royal family in Eastbourne, the Salvation Army refused an appeal by the authorities to suspend their outdoor processions.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — Scenes of great turbulence were caused by the operations of the Salvation Army at Eastbourne yesterday. The Salva­tionists refused an appeal by the authorities to suspend their outdoor processions over the period occupied by the visit of the Prince and Princess of Wales and family, and this circumstance, together with the fact that a poll of the borough is now being taken on the Sunday Bands question, appeared to incense the crowd, who attacked the Salvationist procession at several points of their route.
snippet: During the visit of the royal family in Eastbourne, the Salvation Army refused an appeal by the authorities to suspend their outdoor processions....

headline.main: 1892: The “Blood and Fire” Army Resisted by Police
